#summary Installing boinc development files to allow compiling openmalaria

= Introduction =

You may just be able to use the [http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=boinc-dev boinc-dev] package. Otherwise, read on...


= Details =

Check out a copy of boinc. Normally you can use the latest stable:
{{{
svn co http://boinc.berkeley.edu/svn/branches/server_stable boinc
cd boinc
}}}
For older systems, this may not work. For ubuntu 6.06:
{{{
svn co http://boinc.berkeley.edu/svn/branches/boinc_core_release_5_10 boinc
cd boinc
}}}

Configure:
{{{
./_autosetup
#for compiling a release version, we only want static libraries:
./configure --disable-client --disable-shared --disable-server -C
}}}

You only need the main lib and api; to save time just build and install these:
{{{
cd lib
make
sudo make install
cd ../api
make
sudo make install
}}}
